prior_works.title: Microsoft COCO: Common Objects in Context
prior_works.relationship_sentence: COCO directly shaped SARDet-100K’s goal of a COCO-level large-scale detection benchmark and motivated its adoption of COCO-style JSON annotations and standardized mAP evaluation.

prior_works.title: DOTA: A Large-scale Dataset for Object Detection in Aerial Images
prior_works.relationship_sentence: DOTA provided a remote-sensing–specific precedent for large-scale, multi-class object detection benchmarks and influenced SARDet-100K’s dataset design and evaluation protocols in the aerial-imagery context.

prior_works.title: MMDetection: Open MMLab Detection Toolbox and Benchmark
prior_works.relationship_sentence: MMDetection’s modular training/evaluation framework and COCO-compatible interfaces directly enabled SARDet-100K’s open-source toolkit and large-scale, reproducible benchmarking across many detectors.

prior_works.title: OpenSARShip: A Dataset Dedicated to Sentinel-1 Ship Detection
prior_works.relationship_sentence: OpenSARShip contributed diverse Sentinel-1 maritime scenes and labels that were standardized and integrated as a key component of the multi-source SARDet-100K benchmark.

prior_works.title: HRSID: A High-Resolution SAR Images Dataset for Ship Detection
prior_works.relationship_sentence: HRSID supplied high-resolution ship annotations that, once unified, expanded SARDet-100K’s scale and resolution diversity for robust maritime detection evaluation.

prior_works.title: SSDD: SAR Ship Detection Dataset
prior_works.relationship_sentence: SSDD’s widely used ship imagery and labels were a foundational ingredient that SARDet-100K standardized to alleviate fragmentation in SAR ship detection research.

prior_works.title: SAR-Aircraft-1.0: A Dataset for Aircraft Detection in SAR Images
prior_works.relationship_sentence: SAR-Aircraft-1.0 provided non-maritime targets and helped SARDet-100K move beyond mono-category ship detection toward a multi-class SAR detection benchmark.

synthesis_narrative: SARDet-100K’s core contributions—unifying fragmented SAR detection datasets into a large-scale, COCO-level multi-class benchmark and releasing an open-source toolkit—draw directly on two lines of prior work: large-scale detection benchmarks/toolboxes and existing SAR detection datasets. First, COCO established the template for modern detection benchmarks, including scale, COCO-style JSON annotations, and standardized mAP metrics; SARDet-100K explicitly targets COCO-level scope and inherits its evaluation conventions. In remote sensing, DOTA demonstrated how to adapt large-scale object detection to aerial imagery, influencing SARDet-100K’s multi-class scope, data curation principles, and evaluation in a domain with unique viewing geometries. Operationally, MMDetection provided the modular, COCO-compatible training and evaluation infrastructure that SARDet-100K extends to ensure reproducible baselines and broad detector coverage. Second, the benchmark’s substance comes from consolidating established SAR detection datasets that were previously small, mono-class, and siloed. OpenSARShip (Sentinel-1) and HRSID contributed high-resolution maritime scenes, SSDD added a widely adopted ship corpus, and SAR-Aircraft-1.0 supplied non-ship categories, enabling true multi-class detection. Standardizing these sources into a single, quality-controlled benchmark enabled comprehensive cross-sensor and cross-category experiments. This consolidation, together with a unified toolkit, allowed the authors to rigorously expose the performance gap between RGB-pretrained models and SAR fine-tuning, a challenge that was difficult to quantify before the availability of a large, diverse SAR benchmark.
